intro: Vriesea olmosana, commonly known as the Olmosana凤梨, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, showy inflorescence that typically displays colors ranging from red to orange. Its rosette of sword-shaped leaves is adapted to collect and store water, a feature common in bromeliads. Vriesea olmosana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
